Name: Timothy Miller
AboutMe: I am an Assistant Professor of Computer Science at Binghamton University (SUNY). I received my PhD from Ohio State in 2012. Prior to graduate school, I worked in industry for 9 years doing software engineering and digital circuit design (among other things). I am the principal designer of a graphics accelerator used in air traffic control display systems around the world, and I founded the Open Graphics Project. I currently do research in Computer Architecture, focusing on energy efficiency and reliability, making heavy use of machine learning and closed-loop control systems.
